alert.note: Alert for Bedford; Cambria; Somerset (Pennsylvania) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Advisory issued June 16 at 7:02AM EDT by NWS State College
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 10 AM EDT THIS MORNING... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected. * WHERE...A portion of central Pennsylvania, including the following counties, Bedford, Cambria and Somerset. * WHEN...Until 1000 AM EDT. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. Rapid rises in small streams with some possibly exceeding bankfull. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 659 AM EDT, Doppler radar indicated heavy rain due to thunderstorms. Minor flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly in the advisory area. Between 1 and 2 inches of rain have fallen. - Additional rainfall of 0.5 to 1 inches is expected over the area between 7 and 8 am. This additional rain will result in minor flooding. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Johnstown, Somerset, Windber, Bedford, Belmont, Geistown, Meyersdale, Berlin, Clearville, New Enterprise, Everett, Friedens, Boswell, Osterburg, Salix-Beauty Line Park, Davidsville, Central City, Paint, Jerome and Buffalo Mills. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. In hilly terrain there are hundreds of low water crossings which are potentially dangerous in heavy rain. Do not attempt to cross flooded roads. Find an alternate route.
